text: Typhoon Vera, also called the Isewan Typhoon, was a super typhoon that struck Japan in September 1959. It was the strongest and deadliest typhoon ever in the country. It was also a severe setback to the Japanese economy (Japan was still recovering from World War II). Vera's wind speed was . It was given the name "Vera" by the Joint Typhoon Warning Center. It caused extensive damage to Ise Bay (Isewan in Japanese) which is why it is called the Isewan Typhoon in Japan. Overall damage from the storm was Â¥600 million. More than 5,000 people lost their lives in the typhoon. ==References== Category:Tropical cyclones in Asia Category:Pacific typhoons Category:1959 in Asia Category:20th century in Japan Category:Deadly storms Category:1950s in weather
title: Typhoon Vera
